title: Ella Fitzgerald - Rhythm Is My Business (Verve,1962) RESEED
description:
MP3/320Kbps

In 1962 organist Bill Doggett took time out from his successful R&B career to return to his roots ad record this big-band session with Ella Fitzgerald. Doggett&#039;s organ and simple, driving arrangements provided the perfect foundation for Ella&#039;s unassailable voice, proving once again that rhythm truly was her business! In addition to the original-LP&#039;s selections, there are two previously unissued bonus tracks.

Personnel:
Ella Fitzgerald - Vocals
Taft Jordan - Trumpet
Ernie Royal - Trumpet
Joe Wilder - Trumpet
Melba Liston - Trombone
Kai Winding - Trombone
Britt Woodman - Trombone
Carl Davis - Reeds
Jerry Dodgion - Reeds
William Shakesnider - Reeds
Les Taylor - Reeds
Phil Woods - Reeds
Hank Jones - Piano
Mundell Lowe - Guitar
Lucile Dixon - Bass
George Duvivier - Bass
Gus Johnson - Drums
Bill Doggett - Arranger, Conductor

Producer Norman Granz
Recorded January 30/31, 1962 , Webster Hall, New York City.


Track listing :
1. "Rough Ridin&#039;" (Ella Fitzgerald, Hank Jones, William Tennyson) 2:51
2. "Broadway" (Billy Bird, Teddy McRae, Henri Woode) 2:43
3. "You Can Depend on Me" (Charles Carpenter, Louis Dunlap, Earl Hines) 3:32
4. "Runnin&#039; Wild" (Arthur Gibbs, Joe Grey, Leo Wood) 2:40
5. "Show Me the Way to Go Out of This World &#039;Cause That&#039;s Where Everything Is" (Les Clark, Matt Dennis) 2:42
6. "I&#039;ll Always Be In Love With You" (Bud Green, Herman Ruby, Sam H. Stept) 2:50
7. "Hallelujah, I Love Him So" (Ray Charles) 2:34
8. "I Can&#039;t Face the Music" (Rube Bloom, Ted Koehler) 5:00
9. "No Moon at All" (Redd Evans, Dave Mann) 2:36
10. "Laughin&#039; on the Outside" (Ben Raleigh, Bernie Wayne) 4:53
11. "After You&#039;ve Gone" (Henry Creamer, Turner Layton) 4:08
12. "Taking a Chance on Love" (Vernon Duke, Ted Fetter, John Latouche) 2:35
13. "If I Could Be With You" (Creamer, James P. Johnson) 2:39

* Tracks 12 and 13 were previously unissued.
